text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.

* Authorities in the districts of Amadora, Cascais, Oeiras and Sintra, on the outskirts of Lisbon, have decided to study the viability of an underground metro system that would link the four areas. The studies may be concluded by the end of 1998.
* Portugal Telecom workers say salaries and career structures should be adjusted after the merger of TLP-Telefones de Lisboa e Porto and TDP with Portugal Telecom.
* The board of state airline TAP-Air Portugal responds positively to the demands of protesting pilots.
* Banco Mello boosts first-half profit by 801 percent to 1.4 billion escudos.

* The competitiveness of the Portuguese ship repair sector has dropped since 1989, in part due to the government's "strong escudo" policy, the European Association of Ship Builders and Repair Companies said.
